answers.answer: Are there any medical concerns associated to the pregnancy or that you may have prior?
Only reason is that my baby is measuring small. He is 4lbs 11oz
That doesn't make sense to be induced because baby is measuring small you would think they would want you to go full term to give your baby more of a chance to grow?
Or is the doctor going on vacation and its more convenient just to induce? There is a doctor that did that to a friend of mine, smh...

I think I'd be asking more questions and refuse to be induced, unless there was another medical reason like toxemia or preeclampsia... Or asking another doc in the practice for their opinion, js...I don't trust some doctors cause some of the are just educated, egotistical idiots
What are questions I need to be asking
It could be that the baby stopped growing thats the only reason I could think of for you to be induced for a small baby.

They should not be inducing you because of a small baby.  If the baby is small then they baby should be in full term if not more. Must be other health concerns.  Ask why you need to be induced. Why should the baby come out earlier if they're so small. There's a possibility I could be induced, but it's because my baby is already estimated to be born at 9.5lbs full term due to gestational diabetes.

IUGR can be a reason for a tiny baby and an early induction but I definitely agree with the above posters. Ask lots of questions - find out why they want to induce early, what the risks are and what are the expected benefits. If their reasoning isn't clear or doesn't sound like a good enough reason (ie if your doc is going on vacation that's a pretty bad reason) then you can refuse the induction and wait for labor to start naturally.

My son had iugr and they took him at 36 wks. If I went.to full term they said he would have.gotten smaller BC my placenta WaSnt functioning correctly d he.most.likely would have health issues. In my opinion they shouldn't wait until two wks I'd ask about it now if he isn't growing I don't know why they let you continue with pregnancy. At 36 wks my son was healthy other than weighing 4.3lbs
Why would you want to continue longer if the baby's isn't getting g everything they need.to drow and be healthy. Better out then in. I'm speaking from my experience also.

Watch " The business of being born ". Don't let them induce with cytotec or its generic equivalent, it can cause uterine rupture. Only let them use pitocin. But I would be wary about inducing at 38 weeks. Due dates are sometimesOff by a week or two, and so your baby could actually be younger than you think and an induction could be bad. Ultrasound weight predictions are usually wrong, too. A lot of doctors won't even do them anymore. Unless your placenta is showing signs of distress or your amniotic fluid is too low, I would not allow such an early induction. Ask them to do a few non- stress tests first and if baby is acting normal there is probably no harm in waiting. Good luck.
For.me they said he was measuring smaller for.the last month A d a half so I def. Felt it was right.for me. I didn't want to go full term and have  stillborn BC I refused it.
I actually had a friend who was measuring small and they induced her 3 weeks early. The reason why is because her placenta was bad and wasn't giving the baby the nutrients it needed to grow.

Guys she just asked what questions not be overwhelmed with your opinions... Iugr is real and it is scary to think your baby is getting the nutrients he needs... Staying in is best IF baby is getting what he needs and her's isn't.To the poster I would ask what type of induction as they can use a balloon to dialate, cytotec or another vaginal pill or will they start pitocin right away... May depend if your cervix is open yet. Also I would ask why they are waiting two weeks and if you will have another scan to see if baby is growing in those two weeks... If you have any other questions please private message me... I'm a pedi nurse and my sister has worked on ldrp for years

My baby is suffering from IUGR and they will induce me the moment they decide it is in the best interest for my baby. As of right now my doctor and MFM is hoping I make it to 37 weeks, 32 weeks right now. Once at full term baby will get more nutrients and oxygen that she is not getting inside. If I risk it and wait to go into labor naturally I am putting the baby and myself at risk of not surviving and leaving my current two children without a mom.
He is growing just not as fast as they want I guess. I've had my placenta & amniotic fluid checked twice in the last 2 weeks & they were fine

question: I just found out I will be getting induced at 38 weeks (im.currently 36). What are some questions I should ask the dr about the process and/or alternatives to induction. I am a ftm & want to be completely informed.
title: induction.. Help
